author: chris2_2_2
content: Btw for the next call don’t forget that most ASICS are 5gb so they will be knocked off in the next 1-2 months. Probably 15-25% of hashrate is 5gb ASICS. We’ve also lost 3% of our customers in the past month due to eth price decrease and I assume other pools are worse off. It’ll likely just get worse due to summer heat plus price decrease.

author: 0xsadcat
content: What would happen if there were several blocks with merge ttd distributed at the same time, with different nodes receiving different blocks first? The first proposer chooses and others accept even if locally their head is different?

author: ajsutton
content: Consensus layer fork choice rules take over and decide which chain is canonical.

author: 0xsadcat
content: Yes but on the lowest level that means first proposer overrides pow head for everyone right? Otherwise it could stall

author: ajsutton
content: Not necessarily. If there's a fork on the beacon chain there may be multiple beacon blocks which are the merge block for their chain and fork choice will choose between them.

author: 0xsadcat
content: I see. So there's no risk from this attack even if there are 10 near equal partitions?

author: treyzania
content: it will eventually converge

author: ajsutton
content: It's just a fork in the beacon chain same as any other fork.

author: alexssd7fp
content: You can't know for sure since it's P2P

author: ithaka42
content: Hi all - I am trying to better understand how staking works in ETH2 particularly as it relates to staking yields... Does anyone know of any good sites/resources that explain (and predict) ETH2 staking yields? Have heard 6-8% more realistic post-merge after demand decreased with bear market (instead of 10-15%) but looking for something more in depth that explains how demand factors in.

content: Apologies if this is not the right channel... Haven't asked around a lot and I am looking for deeper/more technical resources
